div.h1: Welcome to the Parent/Student Resources Page
div.p:
ISD 518’s Distance Learning will begin on Monday, March 30, 2020 and continue until May 4, 2020 or longer, as deemed necessary by Minnesota’s Governor.
Students will not have school during this time but it is very important they practice social distancing and stay home.
The most effective way to keep germs away is to wash your hands with soap for at least 20 seconds, multiple times per day.

p.a: View the Student Page for Distance Learning with Help Guides & Videos
Public WiFi Locations Throughout Noble’s County

ul.li: Governor Walz orders MN Schools Closed March 18, 2020 – March 27, 2020

Beginning on Wednesday, March 18, 2020, all ISD 518 school buildings will be closed to students and the public until March 27, 2020. This includes every school building: Prairie Elementary, Middle School, Learning Center, High School, and West/Community Education building.
During this time of closure, our teachers will work on developing plans to continue educating students through distance learning.
Governor Walz will reassess the situation on March 27 and determine if Minnesota schools will be reopened or if we will continue the school year with distance learning.

ISD 518 will continue to offer a school food service program. There will be seven locations throughout our community to distribute meals to students. Please view the School Lunch Program Family Letter to view locations and times (listed below under “School Information” heading).
All field trips, activities, conferences, sports, etc. will be suspended until further notice.
No homework will be given for any grade level during March 18, 2020 – March 27, 2020 per the Governor’s order.
Students will not have school from Wednesday, March 18, 2020 – Friday, March 27, 2020.
March 25, 2020, Governor Walz orders all Minnesota schools to begin Distance Learning beginning Monday, March 30, 2020 – May 4, 2020 or longer, if deemed necessary.
